availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Boyle (Lt col 9th KY Cav USA, Adjutant General of Ky 1863-64)

body.p: Kentucky attorney and soldier. Illinois native. Son of James M. Boyle and Sarah A. Boyle. Married to Jennie Looney Boyle. Father of John Boyle, Jr., Richard Allen Boyle, Mary Boyle, and J. A. Boyle. Educated in the law and admitted to the bar. Attorney in Buck Township, Illinois, in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a lieutenant colonel from August 22, 1862, to September 11, 1863. Served as Adjutant General of Kentucky with a rank of brigadier general from September 1, 1863, to August 1,1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, Edgar County, District 19, p. 146B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Edgar County, Buck Township, p. 675.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), vii, 228, 251.
“Death of General John Boyle,” Mohave County Miner (Kingman, Arizona), December 13, 1913.
"John Boyle (1839-1913)," Find A Grave, Memorial #5747162, accessed August 8, 2019, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5747162.
